solution_line_template: The bus to Ryan's work takes {bus_time_longer_than_bike} minutes longer than his bike ride, so it takes {bus_time_longer_than_bike} + {bike_time} = <<{bus_time_longer_than_bike}+{bike_time}={bus_time}>>{bus_time} minutes.
Ryan takes the bus {bus_rides_per_week} times a week, so the bus rides take {bus_time} * {bus_rides_per_week} = <<{bus_time}*{bus_rides_per_week}={total_bus_time}>>{total_bus_time} minutes a week.

His friend cuts {friend_time_cut_fraction} off his biking time, which is {friend_time_cut_fraction}*{bike_time} = <<{friend_time_cut_fraction}*{bike_time}={time_cut_by_friend}>>{time_cut_by_friend} minutes a week.
This means his friend takes {bike_time}-{time_cut_by_friend} = <<{bike_time}-{time_cut_by_friend}={friend_drive_time}>>{friend_drive_time} minutes to drive him.

Therefore, Ryan spends {total_bus_time} + {friend_drive_time} + {bike_time} = <<{total_bus_time}+{friend_drive_time}+{bike_time}={total_commuting_time}>>{total_commuting_time} minutes every week commuting to work.
